development_errors.ids_dont_exist: There are currently no elements with the following IDs: {ids}!
development_errors.ids_in_use: The following IDs are already in use by some HTML elements: {ids}!

errors.blocked_reference_key: The provided reference key '{reference_key}' cannot be currently used for a new {instance_type} instance as it is being referenced by a {blocker_instance_type} instance with the reference key '{blocker}'!
errors.instance_key_exists: There already exists a {instance_type} with the reference key '{reference_key}'! Either remove it first or use a different reference key!
errors.invalid_optimization_level: The given optimization level '{optimization_level}' is invalid! Valid values are between 0 and 3 (inclusive)!
errors.large_qubit_number: There is no qubit with the number {qubit}. The largest number to access a qubit from this data is {max_qubits}!
errors.negative_qubit_number: Qubit numbers cannot be lower than 0! The number {qubit} goes against this!
errors.no_qubits_numbers: At least one qubit number must be given in order to retrieve noise data!
errors.no_key_instance: There is currently no available {instance_type} with the reference key '{reference_key}'!
errors.not_linked: There is no linked {class_name} object! Please use the method {method_name}(object: {class_name}) before executing this method!

adding_errors.text: Creating and adding depolarizing, thermal relaxation, and readout errors.

created_new_object.text: {class_name} class object has been created successfully!

created_instance.text: {instance_type} has been created successfully! It can now be accessed with the following reference key: {reference_key}.

exception_occurred.text: AN EXCEPTION HAS OCCURED. PLEASE VIEW THE ERROR LOG FOR MORE DETAILS!
highlightables: AN EXCEPTION HAS OCCURED. PLEASE VIEW THE ERROR LOG FOR MORE DETAILS!

executing_simulator.text: Executing {qubit_count} qubit circuit with {shots} shots on the simulator {reference_key}.

execution_complete.text: Circuit execution completed successfully! Result job has been returned!

import_csv.text: Continue by importing the QPU calibration data CSV file: object.import_csv_data('path/to/file.csv').

import_csv_file_information.text: Importing noise data from the CSV file {file_name} located at the following path: {file_path}.

modified_reference_key.text: Empty spaces (' ') have been detected in the new instance reference key! They have been replaced with '_'! Adjusted reference key: {reference_key}!

not_adding_errors.text: Creating a noiseless noise model with no errors.

reset_time.text: CSV files currently do not contain Reset operation times. A default value of 1300 ns has been set.

successful_csv_import.text: Data from CSV file has been imported successfully! It can now be accessed with the following reference key: {reference_key}.

transpiling_circuit.text: Transpiling circuit with optimization level {optimization_level} for simulator execution.

qubit_noise_data_retrieved.text: Noise data for all requested qubits from the instance {reference_key} has been retrieved successfully!

output_headings.creating_noise_model: Creating noise model from noise data instance '{reference_key}'
output_headings.creating_simulator: Creating simulator from noise model instance '{reference_key}'
output_headings.csv_information: Information on all currently relevant CSV calibration data columns
output_headings.importing_csv: Importing data from the selected CSV file
output_headings.retrieving_qubits: Retrieving information about qubits {qubits} from noise data instance '{reference_key}'

terminal.confirm_update: Do you want to update [name]Interactive Noisy Simulation[/name]? [command](y/n)[/command]
terminal.outdated_version:
The current version is outdated.
Able to update from [highlight]v{current_version}[/highlight] to [highlight]v{latest_version}[/highlight].
terminal.update_successful:
Package [name]Interactive Noisy Simulation[/name] has been [success]updated successfully[/success]!
Press [command]ENTER[/command] to continue.

terminal_command_descriptions.help: Interactive Noisy Simulation package. Any functionality that is accessed through the terminal is only related to package management and not the functionality that it provides.
terminal_command_descriptions.update: Checks if a newer version is available. If yes, the package can be updated, based on choice of user (yes / no).
terminal_command_descriptions.version: Prints current version of package and tells if there is a newer version.
